page.title: 11B1363
page.content: The land consists of mainly eight cultivated fields. Growing in the fields are barley, sugar beet, and wheat. Two of the fields are ploughed. Seven of the fields are enclosed and are used for grazing - horses, sheep and cows. The area is dominated by deciduous trees, mainly oak. The fields are divided by hawthorn hedges. Two roads run north to south. The largest is the B1363 which runs down the western side of the area. This road is serviced by a bus route. Down the eastern side runs a small "farms only" road which serves 3 of the farms. A large ditch runs down the right hand side of the road. The land is crossed by 2 footpaths which are very wet due to the rainly summer.
